item.title: 18 Dec 18:51 - Fix cg-push not always defaulting to 'master' remotely
item.author: Petr Baudis <pasky@suse.cz>
item.description: Fix cg-push not always defaulting to 'master' remotely
item.content:encoded:
Fix cg-push not always defaulting to 'master' remotely

cg-push from non-master branch wouldn't default to master remote branch,
but to the same-named remote branch - that was a bug. Actually, we
would still default to master when doing local same-repo push anyway,
making everything even more confusing. Now it's consistent and correct.

cg-push

item.title: 14 Dec 23:51 - Whitespaces safety fixes
item.author: Petr Baudis <pasky@suse.cz>
item.content:encoded:
Whitespaces safety fixes

Fix hopefully all the possible whitespace and metacharacters related
problems by carefully quoting everything. Even most of the things clearly
unneeded, because it doesn't harm and I want to cultivate a reflex to panic
and closely investigate if anything unquoted passes by, so that we _stay_
safe in the future as well.

Such a large patch is bound to introduce some (probably mostly trivial) bugs,
so please test this carefully.

cg-admin-ls
cg-admin-lsobj
cg-admin-uncommit

t/t9400-clean.sh

item.title: 13 Dec 00:38 - [PATCH] cg-clean: be safer by running everything from relpath
item.author: Pavel Roskin <proski@gnu.org>
item.description: [PATCH] cg-clean: be safer by running everything from relpath
item.content:encoded:
[PATCH] cg-clean: be safer by running everything from relpath

cg-clean is broken by commit 3cddede46dcd24bd7c36827ca564de23b2bb3517 -
it removes all subdirectories when run in the top level directory.

Although it's easy to make a one-line fix, I'd prefer a solution that
makes cg-clean potentially safer. Since git-ls-files runs in
subdirectories now, it's no longer needed to run anything in the top
level directory and filter out the results. cg-clean now changes to
$_git_relpath on startup and never uses $_git_relpath again.

Signed-off-by: Pavel Roskin
Signed-off-by: Petr Baudis

cg-clean
